answers.ssml: <speak> Pneumococcal vaccination does not protect against Kowitt 19. However, pneumococcal infections can lead to severe pneumonia and may require ventilation in an intensive care unit. This is particularly important to avoid in a healthcare system that is already overburdened. In general, an appropriate vaccination is recommended for all people who have an increased risk of pneumococcal disease. It is also plausible that pneumococcal vaccination can prevent pneumococcal bacterial superinfection in patients with Kowitt 19. Bacterial pneumococcal superinfections are a well-known complication in influenza diseases. However, the current data situation is insufficient to estimate how often such superinfections occur in Kowitt 19 patients. </speak>

answers.text:
Pneumococcal vaccination does not protect against COVID-19. However, pneumococcal infections can lead to severe pneumonia and may require intensive care for the patient in an intensive care unit. This is particularly important to avoid in a healthcare system that is already overburdened.
In general, an appropriate vaccination is recommended for all people who have an increased risk of pneumococcal disease. It is also plausible that pneumococcal vaccination can prevent bacterial superinfection from pneumococci in patients with COVID-19. Bacterial pneumococcal superinfections are a well-known complication in influenza diseases. However, the current data situation is insufficient to estimate how often such superinfections occur in COVID-19 patients. (1)

answers.ssml: <speak> There are a few cases where the virus is believed to have been transmitted from humans to cats. In the laboratory, cats became infected, but using a very high virus concentration. Infection from cat to cat was also observed in the same laboratory test. The disease was mild. According to previous research, dogs are not at risk. Genetic material of the virus was discovered in two dogs in Hong Kong. However, neither animal showed any symptoms of illness. A study from China also found that dogs are only infectible to a small degree. According to the Federal Research Institute for Animal Health, farm animals are not at risk. So far, there is no evidence that pigs, chickens and other farm animals can become infected with SARS Koff 2. The FLI therefore currently does not recommend testing slaughter animals for the corona virus. There is currently no evidence that pets transmit the coronavirus to humans. Dogs and cats are therefore playing no role in the spread of the pandemic, according to the World Health Organization's findings to date. From the Friedrich-Loeffler-Institut's point of view, contact between healthy people and pets does not have to be restricted. Certainly, pets that have tested positive for SARS Koff 2 do not need to be put to sleep. </speak>

answers.text:
There are a few cases where the virus is believed to have been transmitted from humans to cats. In the laboratory, cats became infected, but using a very high virus concentration. Infection from cat to cat was also observed in the same laboratory test. The disease was mild.

According to previous research, dogs are not at risk. Although genetic material of the virus was discovered in two dogs in Hong Kong, neither animal showed any symptoms of illness. A study from China also found that dogs are only infectible to a small degree.

According to the Federal Research Institute for Animal Health, farm animals are not at risk. So far, there is no evidence that pigs, chickens and other farm animals can become infected with SARS-CoV-2. The FLI therefore currently does not recommend testing slaughter animals for the corona virus.

There is currently no evidence that pets transmit the coronavirus to humans. Dogs and cats are therefore playing no role in the spread of the pandemic, according to the World Health Organization's findings to date. From the Friedrich-Loeffler-Institut's point of view, contact between healthy people and pets does not have to be restricted. Certainly, pets that have tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 do not need to be put to sleep. (1)

answers.ssml: <speak> On March 11, 2020, the WHO Director General declared the situation regarding diseases with the new corona viruses a pandemic. The declaration of the pandemic has no direct impact on preparations and measures in Germany. Germany took the situation very seriously right from the start and implemented the measures itself, which the WHO is now emphasizing, early on. These are. Inform the population about the risks of the disease. Inform the population about how everyone can protect themselves and ask everyone to do so. If possible, find, isolate, test and treat each case, and if possible find all contact persons to prevent further spread. prepare the hospitals for the expected special situation. Prepare medical personnel and protect them from infections. help each other and take care of each other. </speak>

answers.text:
On March 11, 2020, the WHO Director General declared the situation regarding diseases with the new corona viruses to be a pandemic.
The declaration of the pandemic has no direct impact on preparations and measures in Germany. Germany took the situation very seriously right from the start and implemented the measures itself, which the WHO is now emphasizing, early on. These are:
- Inform the population about the risks of the disease
- Inform the population about how everyone can protect themselves and ask everyone to do so
-If possible, find, isolate, test and treat as well as if possible find all contact persons to prevent spreading
- Prepare the hospitals for the special situation to be expected
- Prepare medical personnel and protect them from infections
- Help each other and take care of each other. (1)

answers.ssml: <speak> If there is a loss of work due to loss of earnings, for example because delivery bottlenecks occur as a result of the corona virus and the company is subsequently only able to work to a limited extent or not at all, the employees concerned are entitled to short-time work benefits. Short-time work benefits can be granted for a period of up to twelve months. Short-time work benefit is paid in the same amount as unemployment benefit and is 67 or 60 percent of the difference between the flat-rate net salary that would have been paid without loss of work and the flat-rate net salary from the actual salary received. The responsible employment agency will check in individual cases whether the requirements for granting short-time work benefits are met.On the website of the Federal Ministry of Labor and Social Affairs you will find further relevant questions on the subject of labor law and Kowitt 19. </speak>

Short-time work benefit is paid in the same amount as unemployment benefit and is 67 or 60 percent of the difference between the flat-rate net salary that would have been paid without loss of work and the flat-rate net salary from the actual salary received. answers.ssml: <speak> If a person suffering from a respiratory infection wears mouth and nose protection, the risk of infecting other people can be reduced, since droplets that form when coughing or sneezing are retained. It has not been proven that wearing mouth-nose protection reduces the risk of infection in healthy people. Opinions are divided as to whether wearing a mask can actually slow down the spread of the virus. The World Health Organization, for example, sees no benefit in general wearing mouthguards. Rather, there are additional risks if people remove the masks incorrectly and possibly become infected. She therefore advises against wearing a mouthguard if you are not sick yourself. The head of the National Association of Statutory Health Insurance Physicians also considers the measure to be purely symbolic. The mask conveys a deceptive security, but hardly helps at all. Virologists, on the other hand, believe that people from Hong Kong know that wearing a mask in combination with other rules of conduct can make a significant contribution to keeping the disease under control. And the President of the Robert Koch Institute emphasizes that self-made protection also keeps droplets in place when you cough and sneeze. </speak>

answers.ssml: <speak> Washing hands properly requires careful handling. For example, the hands are often not soaped up long enough and the back of the hand, thumb and fingertips in particular are neglected. First, put your hands under running water. Then soap your hands thoroughly - both the palms of your hands and the back of your hands, fingertips, spaces between fingers and thumbs. Also think of your fingernails. Liquid soaps are more hygienic than soap bars. Washing your hands thoroughly takes 20 to 30 seconds. Then rinse your hands under running water. Then dry your hands carefully, also in the spaces between your fingers. Disposable towels are best suited for this in public toilets. At home, everyone should use their own towel. </speak>

answers.ssml: <speak> There are several ways to calculate mortality. One of them is to take the global case numbers and divide them by the number of deaths. Then you get a mortality rate of around 4 percent. This means that four out of 100 infected people fall victim to the virus. However, this calculation ignores the fact that there are overlooked cases. If these cases were included, the mortality rate would be around half a percent to one percent. In Germany, the mortality rate is currently around 0.4 percent. In contrast, according to Johns Hopkins University in Baltimore, the case mortality rate in Italy was about 20 times higher in the week of March 24, 2020. </speak>

If one were to include these cases, the mortality rate would be approximately 0.5-1 percent. In Germany, the mortality rate is currently around 0.4 percent. answers.ssml: <speak> The treatment of the infection focuses on the optimal supportive measures according to the severity of the clinical picture (e.g. oxygen administration, balance of the fluid balance, possibly antibiotics for the treatment of bacterial superinfections). In Germany, clinical studies are to show whether the Ebola drug remdesivir helps against the new coronavirus, and some patients have already shown very good therapeutic effects. The German Federal Institute for Drugs and Medical Devices has given approval to treat 19 patients with Remdesivir, which are particularly difficult for Kowitt. The European Medicines Agency EMA had announced that there are first signs that remdesivir is also effective against the coronavirus. Furthermore, research is being carried out on the active ingredient APN 0 1, which could soon be ready for use. However, it would probably only help in the phase of the disease before patients would have to be transferred to the intensive care unit. The Guardian also reports on the anti-flu drug Avigan. It is said to have shown good results and few side effects in tests on Chinese Covid-19 patients. However, the remedy only seems to work in patients with milder symptoms. From China there was also a report that the malaria drug chloroquine could help against the coronavirus. But that is not certain. Accelerated tests by the US drug agency FDA are now expected to show more details. US President Trump announced in mid-March that the drug had been approved for the treatment of the coronavirus. Although Trump was promptly corrected by the head of the drug agency, his testimony apparently led to several poisonings. </speak>

answers.text:
The treatment of the infection focuses on the optimal supportive measures according to the severity of the clinical picture (e.g. oxygen administration, balance of the fluid balance, possibly antibiotics for the treatment of bacterial superinfections).

In Germany, clinical studies are to show whether the Ebola drug remdesivir helps against the new coronavirus, and some patients have already shown very good therapeutic effects.

The Federal Institute for Drugs and Medical Devices has given approval to treat patients with Covid-19 who are particularly ill with Remdesivir. The European Medicines Agency EMA had announced that there are first signs that remdesivir is also effective against the coronavirus.

Furthermore, research is being carried out on the active ingredient APN01, which could soon be ready for use. However, it would probably only help in the phase of the disease before patients would have to be transferred to the intensive care unit.

The Guardian also reports on the anti-flu drug Avigan. It is said to have shown good results and few side effects in tests on Chinese Covid-19 patients. However, the remedy only seems to work in patients with milder symptoms.

From China there was also a report that the malaria drug chloroquine could help against the coronavirus. But that is not certain. Accelerated tests by the US drug agency FDA are now expected to show more details. US President Trump announced in mid-March that the drug had been approved for the treatment of the coronavirus. Although Trump was promptly corrected by the head of the drug agency, his testimony apparently led to several poisonings. (1)

answers.ssml: <speak> The previously known corona viruses remain infectious on surfaces such as door handles for an average of four to five days. Like all droplet infections, the new corona virus spreads through the hands and surfaces, which are often touched. Although the virus is new and therefore largely unknown, experts assume that many test results can be transferred via known coronaviruses. There are still no cases where infection from imported toys or other goods has been demonstrated. Initial laboratory tests show that the pathogens can remain infectious for up to 24 hours on cardboard and up to three days on plastic and stainless steel. In general, human corona viruses are not particularly stable on dry surfaces. Because the stability of viruses outside the human organism depends on many environmental factors such as temperature and humidity, infection by post seems rather unlikely. The transmission of SARS Koff 2 via contaminated food is classified as unlikely. There are no indications of SARS Koff 2 infection chains about food consumption, including frozen foods. </speak>

answers.ssml: <speak> There are significant differences in the masks. On the one hand there is the self-made mouth-nose protection (MNS), which can be sewn from fabric. Instructions are available online. These masks do not protect against virus infection, but can trap droplets when speaking, coughing, or sneezing, protecting others from infection. There are also professionally manufactured MNS, which the Robert Koch Institute defines as multi-layer, close-fitting mouth and nose protection. Even professionally manufactured MNS half masks do not protect the wearer from viruses, but can collect droplets from the wearer. There are also certified masks with protective functions that should be reserved for use in hospitals, so that staff do not become infected. These masks are called FFP (filtering facepiece) masks, and they meet certain requirements for filtering particles. FFP2 masks should only be used once. Due to the acute shortage, the RKI recommends that the masks be used again. However, a number of precautions need to be taken. FFP-3 masks have the highest protection level and are also intended to protect against carcinogenic or radioactive particles. Because the filter is very tight, breathing with these masks is difficult. Therefore, they can only be worn for a short time. </speak>

answers.ssml:
In addition to the simple fleece masks, which are worn like cloths over the mouth and nose, there are half masks that filter particles from the air: so-called FFP masks. They are available as three different types.
FFP1: Protects against normal dust in the air
FFP2: Protects against fog, smoke and harmful dust in the air
FFP3: Protects against toxic, carcinogenic and radioactive substances and microorganisms such as bacteria, fungi and viruses in the air
But: High-quality masks of these high protection classes have valves that release the wearer's breathing air to the outside. If the carrier is infected, it would also expel viruses. In addition, the protective effect of these masks is not unlimited, so they have to be changed at regular intervals.
Because their safe use is demanding and, above all, because there is a shortage of these professional masks, they should be reserved for medical personnel until further notice. The mask should no longer be used if it has been moistened or has been in contact with infectious material. With normal, non-medical use, such a mask can last for weeks.

Some people spend a lot of time waiting for the latest news and constantly researching. answers.ssml: <speak> The current restrictions on social contacts and public life are initially set to run until April 18. With the experts, the Federal Government is closely monitoring compliance with the rules and the development of the infection rate. Against this background, the measures taken will be reviewed in due course. Serious estimates of when the number of infected people in Germany will have peaked cannot currently be made. Furthermore, all measures must be based on the actual development of the pandemic. What is to be done is done. </speak>
